pullRequest.title: Add paging to plagiarism results
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
[ ] Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes

Motivation and Context
For exercises with a large amount of submissions, displaying all detected plagiarism matches is quite expensive and slows down the client application. This is why this PR adds paging functionality to show a max. number of 100 matches at once.
Description
I added a small paging panel at the bottom of the sidebar to navigate through multiple pages. Each page will show 100 results.
Steps for Testing
Note: For testing purposes, I decreased the paging size to 10.
The following should work for modeling, text, and programming exercises. Make sure you have multiple similar submissions to generate enough results.

Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration
Select a course
Go to Exercises
Navigate to the details page of an exercise by clicking 'View'
Click 'Check Plagiarism'
Click 'Check Plagiarism' on the plagiarism page and wait for the results
If you have more than 10 results, they should be paged correctly and only 10 results should be displayed at once

Test Coverage

TODO: plagiarism-sidebar.component.spec.ts 25%

Screenshots

commit.message: Add paging panel to plagiarism sidebar
Add paging functionality to plagiarism sidebar
Decrease page size of plagiarism result paging for easier testing
